017package org.apache.juneau.uon;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.StringUtils.*;
021import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
022
023import java.io.*;
024import java.lang.reflect.*;
025import java.nio.charset.*;
026import java.util.*;
027import java.util.function.*;
028
029import org.apache.juneau.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.httppart.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.swap.*;
036
037/**
038 * Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of {@link UonParser}.
039 *
040 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
041 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe and is typically discarded after one use.
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
045 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/UonBasics">UON Basics</a>
046
047 * </ul>
048 */
049@SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
050public class UonParserSession extends ReaderParserSession implements HttpPartParserSession {
051
052   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
053   // Static
054   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
055
056   // Characters that need to be preceded with an escape character.
057   private static final AsciiSet escapedChars = AsciiSet.of("~'\u0001\u0002");
058
059   private static final char AMP='\u0001', EQ='\u0002';  // Flags set in reader to denote & and = characters.
060
061   /**
062    * Creates a new builder for this object.
063    *
064    * @param ctx The context creating this session.
065    * @return A new builder.
066    */
067   public static Builder create(UonParser ctx) {
068      return new Builder(ctx);
069   }
070
071   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
072   // Builder
073   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
074
075   /**
076    * Builder class.
077    */
078   @FluentSetters
079   public static class Builder extends ReaderParserSession.Builder {
080
081      UonParser ctx;
082      boolean decoding;
083
084      /**
085       * Constructor
086       *
087       * @param ctx The context creating this session.
088       */
089      protected Builder(UonParser ctx) {
090         super(ctx);
091         this.ctx = ctx;
092         decoding = ctx.decoding;
093      }
094
095      @Override
096      public UonParserSession build() {
097         return new UonParserSession(this);
098      }
099
100      /**
101       * Overrides the decoding flag on the context for this session.
102       *
103       * @param value The new value for this setting.
104       * @return This object.
105       */
106      @FluentSetter
107      public Builder decoding(boolean value) {
108         decoding = value;
109         return this;
110      }
111
112      // <FluentSetters>
113
114      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
115      public <T> Builder apply(Class<T> type, Consumer<T> apply) {
116         super.apply(type, apply);
117         return this;
118      }
119
120      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
121      public Builder debug(Boolean value) {
122         super.debug(value);
123         return this;
124      }
125
126      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
127      public Builder properties(Map<String,Object> value) {
128         super.properties(value);
129         return this;
130      }
131
132      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
133      public Builder property(String key, Object value) {
134         super.property(key, value);
135         return this;
136      }
137
138      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
139      public Builder unmodifiable() {
140         super.unmodifiable();
141         return this;
142      }
143
144      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
145      public Builder locale(Locale value) {
146         super.locale(value);
147         return this;
148      }
149
150      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
151      public Builder localeDefault(Locale value) {
152         super.localeDefault(value);
153         return this;
154      }
155
156      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
157      public Builder mediaType(MediaType value) {
158         super.mediaType(value);
159         return this;
160      }
161
162      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
163      public Builder mediaTypeDefault(MediaType value) {
164         super.mediaTypeDefault(value);
165         return this;
166      }
167
168      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
169      public Builder timeZone(TimeZone value) {
170         super.timeZone(value);
171         return this;
172      }
173
174      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanSession.Builder */
175      public Builder timeZoneDefault(TimeZone value) {
176         super.timeZoneDefault(value);
177         return this;
178      }
179
180      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserSession.Builder */
181      public Builder javaMethod(Method value) {
182         super.javaMethod(value);
183         return this;
184      }
185
186      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserSession.Builder */
187      public Builder outer(Object value) {
188         super.outer(value);
189         return this;
190      }
191
192      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserSession.Builder */
193      public Builder schema(HttpPartSchema value) {
194         super.schema(value);
195         return this;
196      }
197
198      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserSession.Builder */
199      public Builder schemaDefault(HttpPartSchema value) {
200         super.schemaDefault(value);
201         return this;
202      }
203
204      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParserSession.Builder */
205      public Builder fileCharset(Charset value) {
206         super.fileCharset(value);
207         return this;
208      }
209
210      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.parser.ReaderParserSession.Builder */
211      public Builder streamCharset(Charset value) {
212         super.streamCharset(value);
213         return this;
214      }
215
216      // </FluentSetters>
217   }
218
219   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
220   // Instance
221   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
222
223   private final UonParser ctx;
224   private final boolean decoding;
225
226   /**
227    * Constructor.
228    *
229    * @param builder The builder for this object.
230    */
231   protected UonParserSession(Builder builder) {
232      super(builder);
233      ctx = builder.ctx;
234      decoding = builder.decoding;
235   }
236
237   @Override /* ParserSession */
238   protected <T> T doParse(ParserPipe pipe, ClassMeta<T> type) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
239      try (UonReader r = getUonReader(pipe, decoding)) {
240         T o = parseAnything(type, r, getOuter(), true, null);
241         validateEnd(r);
242         return o;
243      }
244   }
245
246   @Override /* ReaderParserSession */
247   protected <K,V> Map<K,V> doParseIntoMap(ParserPipe pipe, Map<K,V> m, Type keyType, Type valueType) throws Exception {
248      try (UonReader r = getUonReader(pipe, decoding)) {
249         m = parseIntoMap(r, m, (ClassMeta<K>)getClassMeta(keyType), (ClassMeta<V>)getClassMeta(valueType), null);
250         validateEnd(r);
251         return m;
252      }
253   }
254
255   @Override /* ReaderParserSession */
256   protected <E> Collection<E> doParseIntoCollection(ParserPipe pipe, Collection<E> c, Type elementType) throws Exception {
257      try (UonReader r = getUonReader(pipe, decoding)) {
258         c = parseIntoCollection(r, c, (ClassMeta<E>)getClassMeta(elementType), false, null);
259         validateEnd(r);
260         return c;
261      }
262   }
263
264   @Override /* HttpPartParser */
265   public <T> T parse(HttpPartType partType, HttpPartSchema schema, String in, ClassMeta<T> toType) throws ParseException, SchemaValidationException {
266      if (in == null)
267         return null;
268      if (toType.isString() && isNotEmpty(in)) {
269         // Shortcut - If we're returning a string and the value doesn't start with "'" or is "null", then
270         // just return the string since it's a plain value.
271         // This allows us to bypass the creation of a UonParserSession object.
272         char x = firstNonWhitespaceChar(in);
273         if (x != '\'' && x != 'n' && in.indexOf('~') == -1)
274            return (T)in;
275         if (x == 'n' && "null".equals(in))
276            return null;
277      }
278      try (ParserPipe pipe = createPipe(in)) {
279         try (UonReader r = getUonReader(pipe, false)) {
280            return parseAnything(toType, r, null, true, null);
281         }
282      } catch (ParseException e) {
283         throw e;
284      } catch (Exception e) {
285         throw new ParseException(e);
286      }
287   }
288
289   /**
290    * Workhorse method.
291    *
292    * @param <T> The class type being parsed, or <jk>null</jk> if unknown.
293    * @param eType The class type being parsed, or <jk>null</jk> if unknown.
294    * @param r The reader being parsed.
295    * @param outer The outer object (for constructing nested inner classes).
296    * @param isUrlParamValue
297    *    If <jk>true</jk>, then we're parsing a top-level URL-encoded value which is treated a bit different than the
298    *    default case.
299    * @param pMeta The current bean property being parsed.
300    * @return The parsed object.
301    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
302    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
303    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
304    */
305   public <T> T parseAnything(ClassMeta<?> eType, UonReader r, Object outer, boolean isUrlParamValue, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
306
307      if (eType == null)
308         eType = object();
309      ObjectSwap<T,Object> swap = (ObjectSwap<T,Object>)eType.getSwap(this);
310      BuilderSwap<T,Object> builder = (BuilderSwap<T,Object>)eType.getBuilderSwap(this);
311      ClassMeta<?> sType = null;
312      if (builder != null)
313         sType = builder.getBuilderClassMeta(this);
314      else if (swap != null)
315         sType = swap.getSwapClassMeta(this);
316      else
317         sType = eType;
318
319      if (sType.isOptional())
320         return (T)Utils.opt(parseAnything(eType.getElementType(), r, outer, isUrlParamValue, pMeta));
321
322      setCurrentClass(sType);
323
324      Object o = null;
325
326      int c = r.peekSkipWs();
327
328      if (c == -1 || c == AMP) {
329         // If parameter is blank and it's an array or collection, return an empty list.
330         if (sType.isCollectionOrArray())
331            o = sType.newInstance();
332         else if (sType.isString() || sType.isObject())
333            o = "";
334         else if (sType.isPrimitive())
335            o = sType.getPrimitiveDefault();
336         // Otherwise, leave null.
337      } else if (sType.isVoid()) {
338         String s = parseString(r, isUrlParamValue);
339         if (s != null)
340            throw new ParseException(this, "Expected ''null'' for void value, but was ''{0}''.", s);
341      } else if (sType.isObject()) {
342         if (c == '(') {
343            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
344            parseIntoMap(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
345            o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
346         } else if (c == '@') {
347            Collection l = new JsonList(this);
348            o = parseIntoCollection(r, l, sType, isUrlParamValue, pMeta);
349         } else {
350            String s = parseString(r, isUrlParamValue);
351            if (c != '\'') {
352               if ("true".equals(s) || "false".equals(s))
353                  o = Boolean.valueOf(s);
354               else if (! "null".equals(s)) {
355                  if (isNumeric(s))
356                     o = StringUtils.parseNumber(s, Number.class);
357                  else
358                     o = s;
359               }
360            } else {
361               o = s;
362            }
363         }
364      } else if (sType.isBoolean()) {
365         o = parseBoolean(r);
366      } else if (sType.isCharSequence()) {
367         o = parseString(r, isUrlParamValue);
368      } else if (sType.isChar()) {
369         o = parseCharacter(parseString(r, isUrlParamValue));
370      } else if (sType.isNumber()) {
371         o = parseNumber(r, (Class<? extends Number>)sType.getInnerClass());
372      } else if (sType.isMap()) {
373         Map m = (sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Map)sType.newInstance(outer) : newGenericMap(sType));
374         o = parseIntoMap(r, m, sType.getKeyType(), sType.getValueType(), pMeta);
375      } else if (sType.isCollection()) {
376         if (c == '(') {
377            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
378            parseIntoMap(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
379            // Handle case where it's a collection, but serialized as a map with a _type or _value key.
380            if (m.containsKey(getBeanTypePropertyName(sType)))
381               o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
382            // Handle case where it's a collection, but only a single value was specified.
383            else {
384               Collection l = (
385                  sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer)
386                  ? (Collection)sType.newInstance(outer)
387                  : new JsonList(this)
388               );
389               l.add(m.cast(sType.getElementType()));
390               o = l;
391            }
392         } else {
393            Collection l = (
394               sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer)
395               ? (Collection)sType.newInstance(outer)
396               : new JsonList(this)
397            );
398            o = parseIntoCollection(r, l, sType, isUrlParamValue, pMeta);
399         }
400      } else if (builder != null) {
401         BeanMap m = toBeanMap(builder.create(this, eType));
402         m = parseIntoBeanMap(r, m);
403         o = m == null ? null : builder.build(this, m.getBean(), eType);
404      } else if (sType.canCreateNewBean(outer)) {
405         BeanMap m = newBeanMap(outer, sType.getInnerClass());
406         m = parseIntoBeanMap(r, m);
407         o = m == null ? null : m.getBean();
408      } else if (sType.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer)) {
409         String s = parseString(r, isUrlParamValue);
410         if (s != null)
411            o = sType.newInstanceFromString(outer, s);
412      } else if (sType.isArray() || sType.isArgs()) {
413         if (c == '(') {
414            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
415            parseIntoMap(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
416            // Handle case where it's an array, but serialized as a map with a _type or _value key.
417            if (m.containsKey(getBeanTypePropertyName(sType)))
418               o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
419            // Handle case where it's an array, but only a single value was specified.
420            else {
421               ArrayList l = Utils.listOfSize(1);
422               l.add(m.cast(sType.getElementType()));
423               o = toArray(sType, l);
424            }
425         } else {
426            ArrayList l = (ArrayList)parseIntoCollection(r, list(), sType, isUrlParamValue, pMeta);
427            o = toArray(sType, l);
428         }
429      } else if (c == '(') {
430         // It could be a non-bean with _type attribute.
431         JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
432         parseIntoMap(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
433         if (m.containsKey(getBeanTypePropertyName(sType)))
434            o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
435         else if (sType.getProxyInvocationHandler() != null)
436            o = newBeanMap(outer, sType.getInnerClass()).load(m).getBean();
437         else
438            throw new ParseException(this, "Class ''{0}'' could not be instantiated.  Reason: ''{1}''",
439               sType.getInnerClass().getName(), sType.getNotABeanReason());
440      } else if (c == 'n') {
441         r.read(); // NOSONAR - Intentional.
442         parseNull(r);
443      } else {
444         throw new ParseException(this, "Class ''{0}'' could not be instantiated.  Reason: ''{1}''",
445            sType.getInnerClass().getName(), sType.getNotABeanReason());
446      }
447
448      if (o == null && sType.isPrimitive())
449         o = sType.getPrimitiveDefault();
450      if (swap != null && o != null)
451         o = unswap(swap, o, eType);
452
453      if (outer != null)
454         setParent(eType, o, outer);
455
456      return (T)o;
457   }
458
459   private <K,V> Map<K,V> parseIntoMap(UonReader r, Map<K,V> m, ClassMeta<K> keyType, ClassMeta<V> valueType,
460         BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
461
462      if (keyType == null)
463         keyType = (ClassMeta<K>)string();
464
465      int c = r.read();
466      if (c == -1 || c == AMP)
467         return null;
468      if (c == 'n')
469         return (Map<K,V>)parseNull(r);
470      if (c != '(')
471         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '(' at beginning of object.");
472
473      final int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
474      final int S2=2; // Found attrName end, looking for =.
475      final int S3=3; // Found =, looking for valStart.
476      final int S4=4; // Looking for , or )
477      boolean isInEscape = false;
478
479      int state = S1;
480      K currAttr = null;
481      while (c != -1 && c != AMP) {
482         c = r.read();
483         if (! isInEscape) {
484            if (state == S1) {
485               if (c == ')')
486                  return m;
487               if (Character.isWhitespace(c))
488                  skipSpace(r);
489               else {
490                  r.unread();
491                  Object attr = parseAttr(r, decoding);
492                  currAttr = attr == null ? null : convertAttrToType(m, trim(attr.toString()), keyType);
493                  state = S2;
494                  c = 0; // Avoid isInEscape if c was '\'
495               }
496            } else if (state == S2) {
497               if (c == EQ || c == '=')
498                  state = S3;
499               else if (c == -1 || c == ',' || c == ')' || c == AMP) {
500                  if (currAttr == null) {
501                     // Value was '%00'
502                     r.unread();
503                     return null;
504                  }
505                  m.put(currAttr, null);
506                  if (c == ')' || c == -1 || c == AMP)
507                     return m;
508                  state = S1;
509               }
510            } else if (state == S3) {
511               if (c == -1 || c == ',' || c == ')' || c == AMP) {
512                  V value = convertAttrToType(m, "", valueType);
513                  m.put(currAttr, value);
514                  if (c == -1 || c == ')' || c == AMP)
515                     return m;
516                  state = S1;
517               } else  {
518                  V value = parseAnything(valueType, r.unread(), m, false, pMeta);
519                  setName(valueType, value, currAttr);
520                  m.put(currAttr, value);
521                  state = S4;
522                  c = 0; // Avoid isInEscape if c was '\'
523               }
524            } else if (state == S4) {
525               if (c == ',')
526                  state = S1;
527               else if (c == ')' || c == -1 || c == AMP) {
528                  return m;
529               }
530            }
531         }
532         isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
533      }
534      if (state == S1)
535         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on object.");
536      if (state == S2)
537         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '=' following attribute name on object.");
538      if (state == S3)
539         throw new ParseException(this, "Dangling '=' found in object entry");
540      if (state == S4)
541         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ')' marking end of object.");
542
543      return null; // Unreachable.
544   }
545
546   private <E> Collection<E> parseIntoCollection(UonReader r, Collection<E> l, ClassMeta<E> type, boolean isUrlParamValue, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
547
548      int c = r.readSkipWs();
549      if (c == -1 || c == AMP)
550         return null;
551      if (c == 'n')
552         return (Collection<E>)parseNull(r);
553
554      int argIndex = 0;
555
556      // If we're parsing a top-level parameter, we're allowed to have comma-delimited lists outside parenthesis (e.g. "&foo=1,2,3&bar=a,b,c")
557      // This is not allowed at lower levels since we use comma's as end delimiters.
558      boolean isInParens = (c == '@');
559      if (! isInParens) {
560         if (isUrlParamValue)
561            r.unread();
562         else
563            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '(' marking beginning of collection.");
564      } else {
565         r.read();  // NOSONAR - Intentional, we're skipping the '@' character.
566      }
567
568      if (isInParens) {
569         final int S1=1; // Looking for starting of first entry.
570         final int S2=2; // Looking for starting of subsequent entries.
571         final int S3=3; // Looking for , or ) after first entry.
572
573         int state = S1;
574         while (c != -1 && c != AMP) {
575            c = r.read();
576            if (state == S1 || state == S2) {
577               if (c == ')') {
578                  if (state == S2) {
579                     l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(),
580                           r.unread(), l, false, pMeta));
581                     r.read();  // NOSONAR - Intentional, we're skipping the ')' character.
582                  }
583                  return l;
584               } else if (Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
585                  skipSpace(r);
586               } else {
587                  l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(),
588                        r.unread(), l, false, pMeta));
589                  state = S3;
590               }
591            } else if (state == S3) {
592               if (c == ',') {
593                  state = S2;
594               } else if (c == ')') {
595                  return l;
596               }
597            }
598         }
599         if (state == S1 || state == S2)
600            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find start of entry in array.");
601         if (state == S3)
602            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find end of entry in array.");
603
604      } else {
605         final int S1=1; // Looking for starting of entry.
606         final int S2=2; // Looking for , or & or END after first entry.
607
608         int state = S1;
609         while (c != -1 && c != AMP) {
610            c = r.read();
611            if (state == S1) {
612               if (Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
613                  skipSpace(r);
614               } else {
615                  l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(),
616                        r.unread(), l, false, pMeta));
617                  state = S2;
618               }
619            } else if (state == S2) {
620               if (c == ',') {
621                  state = S1;
622               } else if (Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
623                  skipSpace(r);
624               } else if (c == AMP || c == -1) {
625                  r.unread();
626                  return l;
627               }
628            }
629         }
630      }
631
632      return null;  // Unreachable.
633   }
634
635   private <T> BeanMap<T> parseIntoBeanMap(UonReader r, BeanMap<T> m) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
636
637      int c = r.readSkipWs();
638      if (c == -1 || c == AMP)
639         return null;
640      if (c == 'n')
641         return (BeanMap<T>)parseNull(r);
642      if (c != '(')
643         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '(' at beginning of object.");
644
645      final int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
646      final int S2=2; // Found attrName end, looking for =.
647      final int S3=3; // Found =, looking for valStart.
648      final int S4=4; // Looking for , or }
649      boolean isInEscape = false;
650
651      int state = S1;
652      String currAttr = "";
653      mark();
654      try {
655         while (c != -1 && c != AMP) {
656            c = r.read();
657            if (! isInEscape) {
658               if (state == S1) {
659                  if (c == ')' || c == -1 || c == AMP) {
660                     return m;
661                  }
662                  if (Character.isWhitespace(c))
663                     skipSpace(r);
664                  else {
665                     r.unread();
666                     mark();
667                     currAttr = parseAttrName(r, decoding);
668                     if (currAttr == null) { // Value was '%00'
669                        return null;
670                     }
671                     state = S2;
672                  }
673               } else if (state == S2) {
674                  if (c == EQ || c == '=')
675                     state = S3;
676                  else if (c == -1 || c == ',' || c == ')' || c == AMP) {
677                     m.put(currAttr, null);
678                     if (c == ')' || c == -1 || c == AMP) {
679                        return m;
680                     }
681                     state = S1;
682                  }
683               } else if (state == S3) {
684                  if (c == -1 || c == ',' || c == ')' || c == AMP) {
685                     if (! currAttr.equals(getBeanTypePropertyName(m.getClassMeta()))) {
686                        BeanPropertyMeta pMeta = m.getPropertyMeta(currAttr);
687                        if (pMeta == null) {
688                           onUnknownProperty(currAttr, m, null);
689                           unmark();
690                        } else {
691                           unmark();
692                           Object value = convertToType("", pMeta.getClassMeta());
693                           try {
694                              pMeta.set(m, currAttr, value);
695                           } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
696                              onBeanSetterException(pMeta, e);
697                              throw e;
698                           }
699                        }
700                     }
701                     if (c == -1 || c == ')' || c == AMP)
702                        return m;
703                     state = S1;
704                  } else {
705                     if (! currAttr.equals(getBeanTypePropertyName(m.getClassMeta()))) {
706                        BeanPropertyMeta pMeta = m.getPropertyMeta(currAttr);
707                        if (pMeta == null) {
708                           onUnknownProperty(currAttr, m, parseAnything(object(), r.unread(), m.getBean(false), false, null));
709                           unmark();
710                        } else {
711                           unmark();
712                           setCurrentProperty(pMeta);
713                           ClassMeta<?> cm = pMeta.getClassMeta();
714                           Object value = parseAnything(cm, r.unread(), m.getBean(false), false, pMeta);
715                           setName(cm, value, currAttr);
716                           try {
717                              pMeta.set(m, currAttr, value);
718                           } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
719                              onBeanSetterException(pMeta, e);
720                              throw e;
721                           }
722                           setCurrentProperty(null);
723                        }
724                     }
725                     state = S4;
726                  }
727               } else if (state == S4) {
728                  if (c == ',')
729                     state = S1;
730                  else if (c == ')' || c == -1 || c == AMP) {
731                     return m;
732                  }
733               }
734            }
735            isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
736         }
737         if (state == S1)
738            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on object.");
739         if (state == S2)
740            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '=' following attribute name on object.");
741         if (state == S3)
742            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find value following '=' on object.");
743         if (state == S4)
744            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ')' marking end of object.");
745      } finally {
746         unmark();
747      }
748
749      return null; // Unreachable.
750   }
751
752   private Object parseNull(UonReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
753      String s = parseString(r, false);
754      if ("ull".equals(s))
755         return null;
756      throw new ParseException(this, "Unexpected character sequence: ''{0}''", s);
757   }
758
759   /**
760    * Convenience method for parsing an attribute from the specified parser.
761    *
762    * @param r The reader.
763    * @param encoded Whether the attribute is encoded.
764    * @return The parsed object
765    * @throws IOException Exception thrown by underlying stream.
766    * @throws ParseException Attribute was malformed.
767    */
768   protected final Object parseAttr(UonReader r, boolean encoded) throws IOException, ParseException {
769      Object attr;
770      attr = parseAttrName(r, encoded);
771      return attr;
772   }
773
774   /**
775    * Parses an attribute name from the specified reader.
776    *
777    * @param r The reader.
778    * @param encoded Whether the attribute is encoded.
779    * @return The parsed attribute name.
780    * @throws IOException Exception thrown by underlying stream.
781    * @throws ParseException Attribute name was malformed.
782    */
783   protected final String parseAttrName(UonReader r, boolean encoded) throws IOException, ParseException {
784
785      // If string is of form 'xxx', we're looking for ' at the end.
786      // Otherwise, we're looking for '&' or '=' or WS or -1 denoting the end of this string.
787
788      int c = r.peekSkipWs();
789      if (c == '\'')
790         return parsePString(r);
791
792      r.mark();
793      boolean isInEscape = false;
794      if (encoded) {
795         while (c != -1) {
796            c = r.read();
797            if (! isInEscape) {
798               if (c == AMP || c == EQ || c == -1 || Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
799                  if (c != -1)
800                     r.unread();
801                  String s = r.getMarked();
802                  return ("null".equals(s) ? null : s);
803               }
804            }
805            else if (c == AMP)
806               r.replace('&');
807            else if (c == EQ)
808               r.replace('=');
809            isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
810         }
811      } else {
812         while (c != -1) {
813            c = r.read();
814            if (! isInEscape) {
815               if (c == '=' || c == -1 || Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
816                  if (c != -1)
817                     r.unread();
818                  String s = r.getMarked();
819                  return ("null".equals(s) ? null : trim(s));
820               }
821            }
822            isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
823         }
824      }
825
826      // We should never get here.
827      throw new ParseException(this, "Unexpected condition.");
828   }
829
830
831   /*
832    * Returns true if the next character in the stream is preceded by an escape '~' character.
833    */
834   private static final boolean isInEscape(int c, ParserReader r, boolean prevIsInEscape) throws IOException {
835      if (c == '~' && ! prevIsInEscape) {
836         c = r.peek();
837         if (escapedChars.contains(c)) {
838            r.delete();
839            return true;
840         }
841      }
842      return false;
843   }
844
845   /**
846    * Parses a string value from the specified reader.
847    *
848    * @param r The input reader.
849    * @param isUrlParamValue Whether this is a URL parameter.
850    * @return The parsed string.
851    * @throws IOException Exception thrown by underlying stream.
852    * @throws ParseException Malformed input found.
853    */
854   protected final String parseString(UonReader r, boolean isUrlParamValue) throws IOException, ParseException {
855
856      // If string is of form 'xxx', we're looking for ' at the end.
857      // Otherwise, we're looking for ',' or ')' or -1 denoting the end of this string.
858
859      int c = r.peekSkipWs();
860      if (c == '\'')
861         return parsePString(r);
862
863      r.mark();
864      boolean isInEscape = false;
865      String s = null;
866      AsciiSet endChars = (isUrlParamValue ? endCharsParam : endCharsNormal);
867      while (c != -1) {
868         c = r.read();
869         if (! isInEscape) {
870            // If this is a URL parameter value, we're looking for:  &
871            // If not, we're looking for:  &,)
872            if (endChars.contains(c)) {
873               r.unread();
874               c = -1;
875            }
876         }
877         if (c == -1)
878            s = r.getMarked();
879         else if (c == EQ)
880            r.replace('=');
881         else if (Character.isWhitespace(c) && ! isUrlParamValue) {
882            s = r.getMarked(0, -1);
883            skipSpace(r);
884            c = -1;
885         }
886         isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
887      }
888
889      if (isUrlParamValue)
890         s = StringUtils.trim(s);
891
892      return ("null".equals(s) ? null : trim(s));
893   }
894
895   private static final AsciiSet endCharsParam = AsciiSet.of(""+AMP), endCharsNormal = AsciiSet.of(",)"+AMP);
896
897
898   /*
899    * Parses a string of the form "'foo'"
900    * All whitespace within parenthesis are preserved.
901    */
902   private String parsePString(UonReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
903
904      r.read(); // Skip first quote, NOSONAR - Intentional.
905      r.mark();
906      int c = 0;
907
908      boolean isInEscape = false;
909      while (c != -1) {
910         c = r.read();
911         if (! isInEscape) {
912            if (c == '\'')
913               return trim(r.getMarked(0, -1));
914         }
915         if (c == EQ)
916            r.replace('=');
917         isInEscape = isInEscape(c, r, isInEscape);
918      }
919      throw new ParseException(this, "Unmatched parenthesis");
920   }
921
922   private Boolean parseBoolean(UonReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
923      String s = parseString(r, false);
924      if (s == null || s.equals("null"))
925         return null;
926      if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("true"))
927         return true;
928      if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("false"))
929         return false;
930      throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax for boolean.  ''{0}''.", s);
931   }
932
933   private Number parseNumber(UonReader r, Class<? extends Number> c) throws IOException, ParseException {
934      String s = parseString(r, false);
935      if (s == null)
936         return null;
937      return StringUtils.parseNumber(s, c);
938   }
939
940   /*
941    * Call this method after you've finished a parsing a string to make sure that if there's any
942    * remainder in the input, that it consists only of whitespace and comments.
943    */
944   private void validateEnd(UonReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
945      if (! isValidateEnd())
946         return;
947      while (true) {
948         int c = r.read();
949         if (c == -1)
950            return;
951         if (! Character.isWhitespace(c))
952            throw new ParseException(this, "Remainder after parse: ''{0}''.", (char)c);
953      }
954   }
955
956   private static void skipSpace(ParserReader r) throws IOException {
957      int c = 0;
958      while ((c = r.read()) != -1) {
959         if (c <= 2 || ! Character.isWhitespace(c)) {
960            r.unread();
961            return;
962         }
963      }
964   }
965
966   /**
967    * Creates a {@link UonReader} from the specified parser pipe.
968    *
969    * @param pipe The parser input.
970    * @param decodeChars Whether the reader should automatically decode URL-encoded characters.
971    * @return A new {@link UonReader} object.
972    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
973    */
974   public final UonReader getUonReader(ParserPipe pipe, boolean decodeChars) throws IOException {
975      Reader r = pipe.getReader();
976      if (r instanceof UonReader)
977         return (UonReader)r;
978      return new UonReader(pipe, decodeChars);
979   }
980
981   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
982   // Properties
983   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
984
985   /**
986    * Decode <js>"%xx"</js> sequences.
987    *
988    * @see UonParser.Builder#decoding()
989    * @return
990    *    <jk>true</jk> if URI encoded characters should be decoded, <jk>false</jk> if they've already been decoded
991    *    before being passed to this parser.
992    */
993   protected final boolean isDecoding() {
994      return decoding;
995   }
996
997   /**
998    * Validate end.
999    *
1000    * @see UonParser.Builder#validateEnd()
1001    * @return
1002    *    <jk>true</jk> if after parsing a POJO from the input, verifies that the remaining input in
1003    *    the stream consists of only comments or whitespace.
1004    */
1005   protected final boolean isValidateEnd() {
1006      return ctx.isValidateEnd();
1007   }
1008
1009   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1010   // Other methods
1011   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1012
1013   @Override /* ContextSession */
1014   protected JsonMap properties() {
1015      return filteredMap("decoding", decoding);
1016   }
1017}
